item.title: Sarah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Knowledge is not for knowing: knowledge is for cutting." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Sarah add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand
